intro: Caesia lateriflora, commonly known as the side-flowered caesia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and wetlands. Caesia lateriflora is often found in swampy areas and is adapted to tolerate wet soil conditions.
